Column Comment.0: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the project.
Column Comment.1: STEP ID: Unique identifier for the project step.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: ACTUAL END DATE: the date that this step was actually ended.
Column Comment.4: ACTUAL START DATE: the date that this step was actually started.
Column Comment.5: ACTUAL TIME ELAPSED: The actual time that is spent on this project step. If youare tracking PROJECT STEP TIME, can be calculated by summing the times in thattable.
Column Comment.8: CRITICAL DATE: the date that this step must be completed in order for the project tobe completed on time.
Column Comment.9: DESCRIPTION: Text description of this step in the project.
Column Comment.10: DUE DATE: the date that this step is due.
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.12: ESTIMATED TIME ELAPSED: The amount of time that is estimated to be requiredfor the project step.
Column Comment.15: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.16: PLANNED END DATE: the date that this step was intended to be completed.
Column Comment.17: PLANNED START DATE: the date that this step was intended to be started.
Column Comment.18: ALLOWED STEP ID: Unique identifier for a step that is allowed to be included in theproject.
Column Comment.19: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.20: PROJECT PLAND IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the project plan.
Column Comment.21: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.22: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.23: STEP NAME: The name commonly used to identify the name of the step.
Column Comment.24: STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: a number that indicates the order in which steps werecompleted. Concurrent steps may be assigned the same number if you wish.
Column Comment.25: PROJECT STEP TYPE: The type of step for the project.
Column Comment.26: WHERE COMPLETED; unvalidated description of where this step was completed.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.28: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.30: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.33: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
